Detailed Description

Class to contain, decompress and draw a SVG compatible documents.

Member Enumeration Documentation

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SvgImage::SvgImage (   ) 
 

Creates an empty SVG image. To fill the image with data invoke SvgImage::Load afterwards, which does the loading in a background thread so that the calling application still can receive messages.

SvgImage::SvgImage (  BinData *  data,
BOOLEAN *  p_success = 0
) 
 

Creates an SVG image out of the given data. Note that dependant from the complexity of the SVG data the calling application might get blocked for up to 1 second for the loading process. If this is not suitable use the constructor SvgImage::SvgImage() instead and invoke SvgImage::Load afterwards.

Parameters:
data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the SVG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the SVG image and hence automatically released in the destructor of the SVG image.
success Optional output parameter, which indicates whether the initialization has been successful.

SvgImage::~SvgImage (   )  [virtual]
 

Releases the binary data stream m_data if it is still obtained and destructs the object.

BOOLEAN SvgImage::Init (  BinData *  data  ) 
 

Creates an SVG image out of the given data. Note that dependant from the complexity of the SVG data the calling application might get blocked for up to 1 second for the loading process. If this is not suitable use the constructor SvgImage::SvgImage() instead and invoke SvgImage::Load afterwards.

Parameters:
data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the SVG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the SVG image and hence automatically released in the destructor of the SVG image.
Returns:

void SvgImage::Init (   ) 
 

Creates an empty SVG image. To fill the image with data invoke SvgImage::Load afterwards, which does the loading in a background thread so that the calling application still can receive messages.

BOOLEAN SvgImage::Load (  BinData *  data  ) 
 

Loads the SVG data into the SVG engine, so that it can be drawn with SvgImage::Draw afterwards. The loading is done inside a separate thread, so that the calling application still can receive messages during the loading. This benefit also has some drawbacks: the calling application must take care that it will not delete the SvgImage instance during the loading is still active. It is recommended that the calling application disables the current focused control or window when invoking SvgImage::Load:

SvgImage* svg_image = new SvgImage();
if (svg_image != 0) {
	window.SetDisabled(TRUE);
	if (svg_image->Load(data)) {
		...
	}
	window.SetDisabled(FALSE);
}

Disabling the current focused control or window assures that the user cannot trigger e. g. a Window::OnClose, where the SVG-image might get destroyed by the application although the thread still loads the SVG image. If disabling the control is not acceptable, the application itself has to implement an Active Wait mechanism to delay the destruction.

Parameters:
data Pointer to a binary data stream which contains the SVG data. After passing the binary data stream, the stream is obtained by the SVG image and hence automatically released in the destructor of the SVG image.
Returns:
TRUE if the loading has been successful.

BOOLEAN SvgImage::Pan (  SvgFixPoint  dx,
SvgFixPoint  dy
) 
 

Pan does panning on the SVG document. Only possible, if IsDocumentPanable() returns TRUE.

Parameters:
dx pan dx pixels horizontal
dy pan dy pixels vertical
Returns:
returns TRUE if panning was successfully.

void SvgImage::ResetTransformation (   ) 
 

Resets all user transformations such as zoom, pan and rotation

BOOLEAN SvgImage::Rotate (  SvgFixPoint  angle,
SvgFixPoint  x,
SvgFixPoint  y
) 
 

Rotates the SVG document with given angle by the given rotation point.

Parameters:
angle Rotation angle.
x x-coordinate of rotation point.
y y-coordinate of rotation point.
Returns:
TRUE if rotation is possible, FALSE if not. Use GetErrorCode() to determine more error information.

BOOLEAN SvgImage::SetViewportSize (  XYDIM  width,
XYDIM  height
) 
 

Sets the size of the viewport in pixels.

BOOLEAN SvgImage::SetZoomLevel (  SvgFixPoint  magnification  ) 
 

SetZoomLevel can be used to zoom into an SVG document. This is only possible, if IsDocumentZoomable() returns TRUE.

Parameters:
magnification Describes the zoom level.
Returns:
TRUE if zooming was successfully.

BOOLEAN SvgImage::ToUserSpace (  XYDIM  viewport_x,
XYDIM  viewport_y,

)  const

viewport_y y-coordinate of the viewport space.
user_x Output parameter, which contains the x-coordinate of the user space.
user_y Output parameter, which contains the y-coordinate of the user space.
